title: Ticket #7641: Token listing is broken with leading zeros
description: We've found that token request IDs starting with '0' get the leading zero truncated somewhere -- particularly, this issue can be seen when listing the requests with condor_token_request_list.
remarks:
2020-May-13 15:00:19 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Not sure why we'd rather compare strings than force the str-to-int parser to ignore octal, but it doesn't really matter.

2020-May-13 17:15:51 by bbockelm:
This is indeed a bit of a hedge -- I have a suspicion we might go to non-integers some day for request IDs.
check_ins:
2020-May-12 15:27   Check-in [59643]: Version history for #7641. (By Brian Bockelman )
2020-May-12 15:25   Check-in [59642]: Keep a string version of the request ID. #7641 If we convert to an integer, we strip off the leading zeros; keep a copy of the string version so, when a user requests this request ID later on, we can do an exact string match instead of mucking around with integers. [...] (By Brian Bockelman )
creator: bbockelm
